details.title: Left Front, ISF urge EC to ensure Bengal hotels are not occupied by 'outsiders'
details.content: "We have seen hotels and guest houses are still being occupied by outsiders, including BJP leaders, in areas of the five districts where polling will take place in the first phase on March 27," CPI(M) leader Robin Dev told reporters in Kolkata. (READ FULL STORY HERE)

details.title: Latest scenes from Purba Medinipur
details.content:
West Bengal: Preparations underway at a polling booth in Contai, Purba Medinipur, ahead of voting for the first phase of #WestBengalElections2021 tomorrow pic.twitter.com/jmxLFHxzpF

— ANI (@ANI) March 26, 2021

details.title: BJP providing shelter to criminals in Purba Medinipur, Trinamool tells EC
details.content: TMC Rajya Sabha MP Derek O' Brien and Lok Sabha MP Kakali Ghosh Dastidar told reporters they have several reports about "miscreants being brought to Purba Medinipur from neighbouring districts and Kolkata ahead of the polls". (READ FULL STORY HERE)

details.title: EC vehicle set ablaze in West Bengal hours before first phase of assembly polls
details.content: The vehicle was reportedly on its way back after dropping election officials at a polling station, when it was set on fire at Tulsidi village in the once-Maoist-affected 'Jangalmahal' belt of the state, they said. (READ FULL STORY HERE)

details.title: Trinamool Workers injured in a blast at Bankura
details.content:
West Bengal: At least three TMC workers were injured in a blast at the Muraliganj party office in Bankura district, earlier today.

"TMC goons were making bombs inside the party office. It might have exploded suddenly," says a local. pic.twitter.com/NNbPlVR72l

— ANI (@ANI) March 26, 2021

details.title: BJP complains to EC over Trinamool candidate 'distributing cash' among voters
details.content: In a letter to the poll panel, the saffron party attached links of the video, released on Friday, which showed an ex-minister and a TMC candidate from Purulia purportedly distributing cash among the voters. (READ FULL STORY HERE)

details.title: In poll-bound Bengal, Owaisi to address a rally on Saturday
details.content:
West Bengal: AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi arrived in Kolkata, earlier today.

He will address a public meeting in Sagardighi tomorrow. pic.twitter.com/TEI0hTJknX

— ANI (@ANI) March 26, 2021

details.title: SC stays HC order reviving criminal cases against Mamata's election agent
details.content: A bench of Justices Indira Banerjee and Krishna Murari said, "Since the order which affects the petitioner (election agent) herein was passed without hearing him, we deem it appropriate to pass an interim order staying the operation of the order dated March 5, 2021". (READ FULL STORY HERE)

details.title: BJP has become 'Borrowed Janata Party', Trinamool's victory will herald change in 2024: Yashwant Sinha
details.content: Noting that BJP doesn't have a credible face to counter Mamata Banerjee in West Bengal and is dependent on outsiders "Shah-Modi", Sinha said the desperation to win Bengal is driven by the fact that it has slim chances of winning polls in Kerala, Tamil Nadu and Union Territory Puducherry and a victory in Assam, where it is in power, won't be a big prize. (READ FULL STORY HERE)

details.title: Assam polls: State Congress chief Ripun Bora's assets rose by Rs 8.89 lakh since 2016
details.content: With a total worth of nearly Rs one crore, Assam Pradesh Congress Committee president Ripun Bora's asset value has risen by Rs 8. 89 lakh compared to what it was when he had contested the Rajya Sabha elections in 2016. Bora, who is fighting the assembly elections from Gohpur seat, has in his affidavit declared assets worth Rs 98,22, 857, including land, residential accommodation, bank deposits and gold. (READ FULL STORY HERE)

details.title: Polling begins
details.content: Polling begins for 30 seats in the first phase of West Bengal elections amid tight security, where over 73 lakh voters are to decide the fate of 191 candidates.

details.title: People of  West Bengal cast their votes
details.content:
West Bengal: First phase of polling begins in Jhargram #WestBengalElections2021 pic.twitter.com/fHP1oKNQ2x

— ANI (@ANI) March 27, 2021

details.title: Bengal polls: Four points to remember
details.content:
• The elections are being held following COVID-19 guidelines in all nine seats in Purulia, four in Bankura, four in Jhargram and six in Paschim Medinipur, besides the seven seats in high-stakes Purba Medinipur -- the home turf of BJP leader Suvendu Adhikari.
     
  • The elections, which will continue till 6 pm, are being held amid tight security with the Election Commission deploying around 730 companies of central forces, guarding 10,288 polling booths housed in 7,061 premises, officials said.
     
  • Each company of the central forces consists of 100 personnel, they said.
     
  • Besides, 22,092 state police personnel have also been deployed at strategic locations, they added.

details.title: Long queues outside many stations
details.content: Long queues were seen outside many booths even before polling began with people stepping out early to avoid the sweltering heat, besides the uncertainty of being able to cast their votes in case of violence later in the day.

details.title: Fearing heat, violence later, voters are showing up early in large numbers
details.content:
#WestBengalElections2021: Voting underway at a polling centre in West Midnapore pic.twitter.com/h93aLK9UjD

— ANI (@ANI) March 27, 2021

details.title: PM asks people to vote in record numbers
details.content:
"The first phase of elections begin in Assam. Urging those eligible to vote in record numbers. I particularly call upon my young friends to vote.

"Today, Phase 1 of the West Bengal Assembly elections begin. I would request all those who are voters in the seats polling today to exercise their franchise in record numbers," he tweeted.

Today, Phase 1 of the West Bengal Assembly elections begin. I would request all those who are voters in the seats polling today to exercise their franchise in record numbers.

— Narendra Modi (@narendramodi) March 27, 2021

details.title: Purulia: Vehicle on poll duty catches fire
details.content: A vehicle caught fire under mysterious circumstances as it was returning after delivering food to polling workers in Purulia on Friday night ahead of the first phase of polling, here in West Bengal. The driver has been taken for questioning by the police and further details are awaited.

details.title: WATCH | A significant turnout was seen at several Assam booths
details.content:
#WATCH Voters turn out in large numbers in Rupahi, Nagaon District, for voting in the first phase of Assam Assembly elections pic.twitter.com/5vjn7GgVNn

— ANI (@ANI) March 27, 2021

details.title: Social distancing ensured at polling centres
details.content:
#AssamAssemblyPolls: Voters follow physical distancing at polling station set up at Kamala Bari Junior Basic School, Majuli pic.twitter.com/agupM24oBc

— ANI (@ANI) March 27, 2021

details.title: BJP candidate from West Midnapore Samit Das casts vote
details.content:
BJP candidate from West Midnapore, Samit Das casts his vote at a polling booth there in the first phase of #WestBengalElections2021. pic.twitter.com/u4rZxw5a5a

— ANI (@ANI) March 27, 2021

details.title: TMC workers are trying to create trouble: BJP candidate
details.content: Samit Das, BJP candidate from West Midnapore, alleged that TMC workers are trying to create a disturbance in some areas as voting underway smoothly in Midnapore town. TMC workers entered booth no. 266 & 267 to influence the voters and the EC has been notified, he said.

details.title: Nadda urges voters to ensure participation while following norms
details.content: "Today is the first phase of polling in the West Bengal assembly elections. Your vote will decide the future for you and the state. I urge all voters to ensure their participation in this festival of democracy by taking all precautions against COVID-19. Remember, first vote, then breakfast," the BJP chief tweeted.

details.title: Vote fearlessly: Amit Shah urges voters
details.content:
Shah tweeted: "I appeal to voters of the first phase to vote in record numbers fearlessly to restore the pride of Bengal."

"Your one vote will create Bengal as imagined by great men like Subhash Chandra Bose, Gurudev Tagore and Shyama Prasad Mukherjee," he added.

"Today is the first phase of polling in Assam. I appeal to all brothers and sisters, especially the youth, to vote in large numbers to maintain peace, development and prosperity in the state. Your participation in this festival of democracy is the main pillar of the progress of Assam, so please vote," he said.

details.title: Covid protocol strictly followed
details.content:
Temperature of voters being checked, arrangement of masks, gloves, and hand sanitiser made at a primary school - designated as a polling booth - in Lahowal Assembly constituency of Dibrugarh.#AssamAssemblyPolls pic.twitter.com/VOaY0Q0lGl

— ANI (@ANI) March 27, 2021

details.title: Suvendu Adhikari writes to Election Commission
details.content:
Nandigram BJP candidate Suvendu Adhikari writes to Election Commission, seeking suspension of Haldia Addl SP Partha Ghosh, Haldia SDPO Barunbaidya & some other officers of Nandigram Police Station 'for helping TMC members in carrying out malpractices, irregularities during polls'

— ANI (@ANI) March 26, 2021

Voters being influenced & stopped from voting at booth number 149. Overall polling being held peacefully. EVMs malfunctioning at some locations, it happens in all polls, EC is looking into it: Soumendu Adhikari, BJP leader & brother of Suvendu Adhikari#WestBengalElections2021 pic.twitter.com/zr4zyZbFiZ

— ANI (@ANI) March 27, 2021

details.title: Himanta Biswa Sarma urges people to vote for prosperity of Assam
details.content: "Today is a glorious day when you get an opportunity to exercise your democratic right of casting your vote. Please do go out in large numbers. Your vote will ensure the progress, development and prosperity of Assam," the state health minister tweeted.

details.title: How many people are voting in Assam today?
details.content: A total of 8,109,815 voters, including 4,032,481 females, are eligible to cast their votes across 11,537 polling stations mostly covering the eastern Assam's 14 districts.

details.title: TMC MPs to meet West Bengal CEO
details.content: A delegation of TMC MPs to meet West Bengal CEO today at 12 noon to "raise some serious concerns", as voting for the first phase is underway.

details.title: Polling suspended in East Midnapore booth
details.content: Polling in a booth in Contain South Constituency in East Midnapore is suspended as a section of voters alleged they voted for TMC but the VVPAT shows it was in favour of BJP. However, the presiding officer denied the allegation.

details.content:
Attack on CP(I)M candidate in Shalboni, West Midnapore, Sushanta Ghosh's vehicle. One arrested. @NewIndianXpress @gsvasu_TNIE @khogensingh1

— Pranab Mondal (@PranabM29940593) March 27, 2021

details.title: Vote for progress, golden future of Assam: Priyanka Gandhi
details.content: "Today, the first phase of polling is being held in Assam. I appeal to the people of Assam, especially the youth and my sisters, to go to the polling booths today and vote in large numbers," Priyanka Gandhi said in a Facebook post in Hindi.

details.title: BJP alleges political murder as man found dead
details.content: A man, in his mid-30s, was found dead in Keshiary's Begumpur area in the Paschim Medinipur district in the morning, police said. He has been identified as Mangal Soren, they said, adding that his body was found outside his home. The BJP claimed that Soren was their supporter and was allegedly killed by TMC "goons", a charge rubbished by the ruling party.

details.title: Two security personnel injured in bombing, firing
details.content:
East Midnapore: 2 security personnel injured in a firing incident at Satsatmal, Bhagwanpur assembly constituency, early morning today, ahead of voting for West Bengal polls

Those associated with TMC trying to terrorise ppl in Argoal panchayat area: Anup Chakraborty,BJP Dist Pres pic.twitter.com/FQNiKUjtff

— ANI (@ANI) March 27, 2021

details.title: Derek O'Brien writes to EC
details.content: "Voter turnout for ACs Kanthi Dakshin (216)&Kanthi Uttar (213) at 9:13 am was 18.47%&18.95% respectively, 4 mins later at 9:17 am voter turnout reduced to 10.60%&9:40%. Such discrepancy raises question on the genuineness of data issued by EC," he stated.

details.title: First voters in many Assam booths were greeted with saplings
Assam update
details.content: The Charaideo constituency in the state has witnessed the highest voting percentage till now with 32.40 per cent turnout, while the Gohpur constituency witnessed the lowest voting percentage with a 16.35 per cent turnout.

details.title: A voter at a booth at Assam's Nazira

West Bengal BJP President Dilip Ghosh casts his vote at a polling booth in Jhargram in the first phase of state assembly elections. pic.twitter.com/bAL4RulEMy

details.title: People of Assam now know that CAA-NRC won't affect them: CM Sonowal
details.content: Congress and other parties are only seen in the media but BJP and its allies are the ones working on the ground, Sarbananda Sonowal said. The people of Assam now know that CAA-NRC will not affect them and my aim is to make the BJP government in the state again, he said.

details.title: Dilip Ghosh rubbishes TMC's poll rigging allegations
details.content: "Trinamool Congress (TMC) is losing, which is why they are coming up with false narratives. They can go to the Election Commission or the central forces for resolving such problems, but they choose to make accusations," he said after he cast his vote.

details.title: Turnout in Bengal
details.content: In West Bengal, 54.90 per cent turnout has been recorded till 1 PM.

details.title: Assam Congress President Ripun Bora casts his vote
details.content: (Photo| ANI)

details.title: Assam turnout
details.content: Assam recorded a 37.06 per cent turnout till 1 pm across 47 assembly constituencies in the first phase of the state assembly polls.

details.title: TMC writes to Election Commission
details.content: A Trinamool Congress delegation urged the Election Commission to bring back the rule which enjoined upon political parties to appoint only people, registered as voters in an assembly segment where an election booth was located, as polling agents for that booth. (READ MORE)

details.title: People want Congress back in Assam: Ripun Bora
details.content: "The way the people of Gohpur have come out spontaneously, it is a clear signal that people want change and wants Congress this time," Bora said. The Assam Congress Chief Bora, along with his family, cast his vote at a polling booth in the Gohpur district.

details.title: WATCH| Voters queue up early in Bengal to avoid violence
Assam and Bengal turnout
details.content: Assam and West Bengal recorded 62.09 per cent and 70.2 per cent voter turnout till 3 pm respectively, according to the Election Commission of India.

details.title: Violation of poll code: Mamata attacks Modi on his Bangladesh visit
details.content: Sharpening attack on Prime Minister Narendra Modi, Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee said, "elections are underway here and he goes to Bangladesh and lectures on Bengal. It is a total violation of code of conduct of the election".

details.title: The importance of a village 180 km from Dhaka
details.content:
In a bid to woo the Matuas in West Bengal, Prime Minister Narendra Modi visited their most sacred shrine in Bangladesh. Perhaps for the first time in the history of an Indian election that a leader has used foreign soil in an attempt to secure his party's vote bank.

(READ FULL REPORT HERE)

details.title: Mamata  called seeking help, alleges Nandigram BJP leader
details.content: BJP District Vice President in Nandigram Proloy Pal claimed on Saturday that Banerjee called him and sought his help in the election. Later on, the saffron party released an audio of a conversation between Pal and Banerjee. (READ MORE)

details.title: Assam turnout
details.content: Assam recorded 72. 10 per cent voter turnout during the first phase of election till 5PM.

details.title: BJP has acceded defeat in Assam, claims Kharge
details.content: Leader of Opposition in the Rajya Sabha, Mallikarjun Kharge, claimed on Saturday that the BJP has acceded defeat in Assam and throughout the campaign, the ruling party tried to evade questions related to its performance in the last five years.

details.title: West Bengal turnout
details.content: 79.79 per cent of polling has been reported till 5 PM in West Bengal.

details.title: TMC, BJP workers clash in Nandigram, 3 injured
details.content: A clash broke out on Saturday between activists of the BJP and the TMC in Purba Medinipur's Nandigram constituency -- which is set to go to polls on April 1 -- leaving at least three persons seriously injured, a senior police officer here said. (READ MORE)

details.title: First phase of polling concludes in Assam
